attributes.action: Allow disabled persons over 64 on Attendance Allowance access to Motability
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Under current legislation, officially registered disabled persons aged 65 or over are not allowed to claim Disability Living Allowance (DLA) and must instead claim Attendance Allowance.

The terms of the Motability Scheme stipulate that to participate a person must be in receipt of DLA - Attendance Allowance claimants are not allowed to apply.

Under these rules disabled persons over the age of 64 are therefore discrimated against on the grounds of their age, and believe we the Prime Minister should address this disgraceful situation as a matter of urgency.
